title: 6.12.2025 — Saturday
excerpt: Today has just been… annoying as hell from the second I woke up.
content:
Today has just been… annoying as hell from the second I woke up.
Not the dramatic kind of bad day, just that stupid heavy feeling in my chest
like my brain already decided
"yeah, today is gonna suck a little."

I got up, did the usual crap — phone, coffee, autopilot.
And then out of nowhere
the fucking Christmas ads start blasting everywhere.
Way too early.
Way too loud.

All those fake happy families.
The perfect lights.
The stupid jingle bells in the background acting like the world isn't on fire half the time.
It's all so painfully artificial it almost makes me laugh.
Almost.

It doesn't put me in a good mood.
It doesn't make me feel cozy or festive.
It just pisses me off.
Like the whole world is trying to force-feed me joy
when I barely managed to wake up without swearing at the ceiling.

Everyone's already "getting into the Christmas spirit."
Good for them, I guess.
Meanwhile I'm sitting here trying not to scream
because I'm absolutely not in the mood for any of this shit.
Not the lights
not the music
not the cheesy ads pretending life is some perfect snow globe.

I went outside for a bit
froze my ass off
and saw people already hanging decorations
like the season is supposed to magically fix everything.
But it doesn't fix anything for me.
It just makes everything feel a bit heavier
a bit louder
a bit more fake.

Inside me it's just this weird quiet.
Not peaceful.
Not comforting.
Just empty space where something should be.

I don't know what I expected from today
maybe nothing
maybe just a normal Saturday
not this weird grey fog that followed me around all day.

But whatever.
It's evening now.
At least it's quiet.
At least no one's blasting another over-cheerful jingle in my face.

excerpt: Today moved in a soft grey tone. A day that did not ask for much and did not take much either.
content:
Today moved in a soft grey tone. A day that did not ask for much and did not take much either.
Nothing collapsed. Nothing exploded. Nothing demanded my attention.
A quiet stillness that felt almost unreal in its gentleness.

I stayed home and let the silence settle around me like a blanket that did not fully warm me but kept the cold away.
The hours passed without sharp edges. No sudden drops. No unexpected turns.
Only a slow muted rhythm that felt strangely comforting.

There was a kind of honesty in that simplicity.
No performance. No pressure.
Just me. Breathing. Existing. Watching the day unfold without trying to shape it into anything more.

Maybe the quiet days matter more than I admit.
When nothing breaks I finally have space to notice the small things.
The faint echo of my own thoughts.
The way the light shifts on the walls.
The calm that appears when everything else stops shouting.

Today did not change me.
But it did not wear me down either.
And maybe that is enough.
